titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the University at Buffalo Music Library Collection of Wire Recordings, circa 1946-1954
University at Buffalo Music Library Collection of Wire Recordings
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by John Bewley.

publicationstmt.publisher: State University of New York at Buffalo. Music Library

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded in EAD by John Bewley October 2015.
profiledesc.descrules: Finding aid prepared using DACS (Describing Archives: A Content Standard ).

did.head: Collection Overview
did.unittitle: University at Buffalo Music Library Collection of Wire Recordings, circa 1946-1954

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: State University of New York at Buffalo. Music Library

did.langmaterial: No textual materials are included in the collection.

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: State University of New York at Buffalo. Music Library

did.abstract: The collection contains 18 wire recordings the contents of which have not been confirmed.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Specified item], University at Buffalo Music Library Collection of Wire Recordings, circa 1946-1954, Music Library, The State University of New York at Buffalo.

accessrestrict.head: Terms of Access
accessrestrict.p: Materials can be examined by qualified researchers in the Music Library during hours of operation during which Music Librarians are present. In order to insure access, researchers are advised to contact the Music Library in advance of visits.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: Copyright for the materials in the collection does not reside with the Music Library. Therefore, patrons wishing to publish any item, or part of an item from this collection for any purpose, are responsible for securing requisite permissions.

accruals.head: Accruals and Additions
accruals.p: No further accruals are expected to this collection.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The origin of this collection is currently unknown. The collection was sent to an audio reformatting vendor in 2015 for assessment. The sound engineer's comments concerning the condition of the spools is included in the container list. It was determined that the cost of digital reformatting was beyond what the current budget for such work will allow. The dates of the collection are an estimate based on the dates during which wire recordings were at the height of their popularity in the United States.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The collection contains 18 wire recordings. The contents can only be confirmed once the recordings have been reformatted. Notes concerning contents in the container list are based on inscriptions on the spools or their containers. This information is unclear in many cases.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The recordings in the collection have been numbered based on no set order.

did.unittitle: University at Buffalo Music Library Collection of Wire Recordings, Item 1, undated

note.p: Vendor assessment: Slight keystoning, small risk

scopecontent.p: Possible contents: Schoenberg: no title stated

did.unittitle: University at Buffalo Music Library Collection of Wire Recordings, Item 2, undated

note.p: Vendor assessment: Outer pack seems loose, would spend 30-60 min handwinding past loose wire

did.unittitle: University at Buffalo Music Library Collection of Wire Recordings, Item 3, undated

note.p: Vendor assessment: Slight keystoning, but generally ok

did.unittitle: University at Buffalo Music Library Collection of Wire Recordings, Item 4, undated

note.p: Festa isn't clear. The only mass Hindemith composed dates from 1963.

scopecontent.p: Possible contents: Hindemith I festa mass

did.unittitle: University at Buffalo Music Library Collection of Wire Recordings, Item 5, undated

note.p: Stravinsky did not compose a violin sonata so the composer of the 2nd work is not clear.
Vendor assessment: Slight keystoning, flange cracked, small risk

scopecontent.p: Possible contents: Stravinsky: Baiser de la fee ; Violin sonata ; "Claudios??" trial

did.unittitle: University at Buffalo Music Library Collection of Wire Recordings, Item 6, undated

note.p: Vendor assessment: Slight keystoning, but generally ok

scopecontent.p: Possible contents: Mahler: Symphony no. 8, Part II

did.unittitle: University at Buffalo Music Library Collection of Wire Recordings, Item 7, undated

note.p: Vendor assessment: Keystoning, flange cracked, risky. Could spend 1-2 hours slow-winding to get a flat pack before attempting regular playback

scopecontent.p: Possible contents: Mahler: Symphony no. 8, Mvt.? I ; Chabrier: no title stated

did.unittitle: University at Buffalo Music Library Collection of Wire Recordings, Item 8, undated

note.p: Vendor assessment: Slight keystoning, but generally ok

did.unittitle: University at Buffalo Music Library Collection of Wire Recordings, Item 9, undated

note.p: On container: Acis and Galatea I; could Tana be Talma?
Vendor assessment: Slight keystoning, but generally ok

scopecontent.p: Possible contents: Robertson: Fag.? Sonata ; Taylor: Pf variations ; Tana?: Cl. Sonata ; Bonner: Pf trio ; Tana?: repeat

did.unittitle: University at Buffalo Music Library Collection of Wire Recordings, Item 10, undated

note.p: Vendor assessment: Loose pack, keystoning, would spend 30-60 min handwinding past loose wire

did.unittitle: University at Buffalo Music Library Collection of Wire Recordings, Item 11, undated

note.p: Vendor assessment: Loose pack, broken flange. High risk, would require full hand-wind and spool replacement. At least 2-3 hours work

scopecontent.p: Possible contents: Claudio?: 2 pf sonata ; Tala ; Schoenberg: op. 11, no. 1

did.unittitle: University at Buffalo Music Library Collection of Wire Recordings, Item 12, undated

note.p: Could this be Hermann conducting Schoenberg's Chamber symphony?
Vendor assessment: Some loose wire on outmost layer, but seems generally OK. Wouldn't require much handwinding

scopecontent.p: Possible contents: Bernard Hermann: Chamber symphony, 6/5/49 CBS Symph

did.unittitle: University at Buffalo Music Library Collection of Wire Recordings, Item 13, undated

scopecontent.p: Possible contents: Boykan, Cohn, Purcell, Binkerd, Poulenc, Fine, Dello Joio

did.unittitle: University at Buffalo Music Library Collection of Wire Recordings, Item 14, undated

note.p: On container: Paine, Hall, and Schoenberg

scopecontent.p: Possible contents: Schoenberg: Variations op. 43 ; Desmarais: Fant. Vln. Sonata

did.unittitle: University at Buffalo Music Library Collection of Wire Recordings, Item 15, undated

note.p: Vendor assessment: Loose pack, would need hand-wind before playback ~1-2 hrs. Flange seems to have potential of breaking

scopecontent.p: Possible contents: Machaut: Mass ; Palestrina: Mss ; Dufay: Super

did.unittitle: University at Buffalo Music Library Collection of Wire Recordings, Item 16, undated

scopecontent.p: Possible contents: Monteverdi: Acts IV, V ; Perotin

did.unittitle: University at Buffalo Music Library Collection of Wire Recordings, Item 17, undated

note.p: On container: Thompson III, Piston Qu. I
Vendor assessment: Loose pack, broken flange. High risk, would require full hand-wind and spool replacement. At least 2-3 hours work

scopecontent.p: Possible contents: [Berg]: Wozzeck Act III (crossed out) ; Schoenberg: Erwartung

did.unittitle: University at Buffalo Music Library Collection of Wire Recordings, Item 18, undated

note.p: Contents on container: DG [probably Don Giovanni?] crossed out ; Schoenberg ; Boykan.

scopecontent.p: From sample reformatted by vendor the opening is a radio broadcast of a performance (November 2, 3, or 5, 1950) by the New York Philharmonic of Haydn's Sinfonie concertante in B-flat with John Corigliano, violin, Harold Gomberg, oboe, Leonard Rose, cello, William Polisi, bassoon, on WEEI Radio, Boston. With: Schoenberg Variations.
